result.execSummary:
The defendant Howard E Grady was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs due during period of supervision.
Pay supervision fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Pay DNA surcharge of $250.00 (sample previously submitted)

Restitution due by payment plan of $150 a month beginning 10/1/14 payable to Clerk of Courts Office. 
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked of will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Total cost due during term of supervision.
Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked of will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Howard E Grady in court with attorney Wilfred P de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:38pm Detective Michael Buechler sworn and testified. State rests. Defense moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause & binds matter over for trial. State informs. Counsel waives reading and enters a not guilty plea. Pretrial set for 6/2/14.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel advises defendant does qualify for public defender representation and counsel will be appointed.  Counsel waives reading.  Court advises the defendant of the penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  State recommends $15,000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $15,000 cash bail w/conditions:  no contact with R.R. or Fredonia Mobil.  Counsel requesting prelim hrg; not waiving timelimits. Court orders matter adj to 5/22 at 2:15 pm for preliminary hearing.
